intro: Cuatresia hunzikeriana, commonly known as the Huayna Pichia, is a rare and critically endangered species native to the Andean region of Peru. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae, characterized by its woody structure and showy, pink to purple flowers. The plant is adapted to high-altitude environments, typically growing in rocky soils at elevations above 3,000 meters. Due to habitat destruction and limited distribution, it is highly vulnerable to extinction, making conservation efforts crucial for its survival.
